section.title: How the neutron and nova clients work
section.para: The neutron and nova clients are open-source Python clients that let you run commands to make API calls. These clients are easy to learn and use. Each client command runs cURL commands that embed API requests. You can run either client from a desktop machine or remote system, such as a Cloud Server.
To install the nova client on a Linux distribution or on Mac OS X, see “(Optional) Install the nova client with the Cloud Networks extension”.
To install the neutron client on a Linux distribution or on Mac OS X, see “(Optional) Install the neutron client”.
To configure the clients, you update your bash profile to set and export environment variables.

note.para: You can specify a debug parameter on any neutron or nova command to show the underlying API request for the command. This is a good way to become familiar with the API requests.

warning.para: If you upgrade the operating system of the desktop or remote machine where you installed them, you may need to reinstall the neutron or nova clients.
